intro: Vicia militans, commonly known as the soldier bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three small, heart-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale purple or white, followed by elongated pods containing several seeds. Vicia militans is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It is an annual or biennial plant, known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria.
